context: The word 'm채ngivad' is the 3rd person plural present tense form of the Estonian verb 'm채ngima', meaning 'to play'. However, in this context from O. Luts's text, it appears to be used metaphorically to describe stomach noises or rumbling sounds when hungry, similar to how English might say 'my stomach is playing up' or 'making noise'. The sentence structure suggests the soolikad (stomachs) are 'playing' due to hunger.
